required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of an H.Pylori Vaccine in H.Pylori-Negative Adults
clinical_study.official_title: Phase I/II, Randomized, Observer-blind, Placebo-controlled, Single-Center Study of the Tolerability, Immunogenicity, and Efficacy of an Novartis' Investigational H. Pylori Vaccine in H. Pylori-Negative Adults

brief_summary.textblock: To study the safety, immunogenicity and efficacy of an investigational H. pylori vaccine, compared with placebo.

primary_outcome.measure: The Efficacy (Defined as Prevention of Infection) of the HP Vaccine Compared to Placebo.
primary_outcome.description: The efficacy of the investigational vaccine to prevent infection following H.pylori challenge in healthy adults was determined in terms of percentage of subjects with positive HP infections in the vaccinated and unvaccinated groups(Placebo). Infection rates was assessed by invasive Upper Gastrointestinal Endoscopy (UGE)tests that included HP histopathology, HP culture and rapid urease test (RUT), and non-invasive HP tests which included urea breath test (UBT) and fecal antigen test (FAT).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting Solicited Local* and Systemic Adverse Events Following Vaccination
primary_outcome.description: To assess the tolerability of an HP vaccine versus placebo in terms of number of subjects reporting solicited local* and systemic adverse events.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Time Course of HP Infection Following HP Challenge in Vaccinated and Placebo Groups
secondary_outcome.description: The time course of HP infection following HP challenge in subjects of the HP vaccine and placebo groups, were assessed by non-invasive HP tests.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Geometric Mean Concentrations After HP Vaccination.
secondary_outcome.description: The geometric mean concentration of IgG antibody responses to each of the HP vaccine antigens (VacA, CagA and NAP)after HP vaccination as compared to placebo are reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Concentrations Against Vaccine Antigens After HP Challenge.
secondary_outcome.description: The geometric mean concentration of IgG antibody responses to each of the HP vaccine antigens (VacA, CagA and NAP) after HP challenge were compared between vaccinated and placebo groups.

secondary_outcome.measure: Response on Activated Regulatory T Cell Subset Following HP Vaccination and HP Challenge
secondary_outcome.description: The response to 3 doses of HP vaccine and the oral HP challenge was assessed with respect their ability to induce differentiation and changes in the phenotype of a subset of regulatory T-cells CD4+CD25+Foxp3+ that expresses Treg Markers PD-1 and/or HLA-DR.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proliferative Response Against the Pooled H. Pylori Vaccine Antigens by Stimulation Index (SI)
secondary_outcome.description: The proliferation of H. pylori-specific Peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs) following HP antigen stimulation was assessed to measure the magnitude of the cell mediated immune response.

intervention.description: 1 dose of H.pylori vaccine at 0, 1, and 2 months

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- adults 18 - 40 years of age in good health
- HP uninfected
- not pregnant and agree to use birth control throughout the study (females who can become pregnant)
Exclusion Criteria:
- remote or current HP infection

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were recruited from a single study center in Germany
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: All subjects enrolled were included in the trial.

group.title: Group I (HP Vaccine)
group.description: Subjects received three injections of HP Vaccine at 0, 1, and 2 months, followed by H.pylori challenge(oral administration of infectious HP inoculum)1 month later.

group.title: Group II (Placebo)
group.description: Subjects received three injections of Placebo at 0, 1, and 2 months,followed by H.pylori challenge (oral administration of infectious HP inoculum)1 month later.

group.title: Group I (HP Vaccine)
group.description: Subjects received three injections of HP Vaccine at 0, 1, and 2 months.

group.title: Group II (Placebo)
group.description: Subjects received three injections of Placebo at 0, 1, and 2 months

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: The Efficacy (Defined as Prevention of Infection) of the HP Vaccine Compared to Placebo.
outcome.description: The efficacy of the investigational vaccine to prevent infection following H.pylori challenge in healthy adults was determined in terms of percentage of subjects with positive HP infections in the vaccinated and unvaccinated groups(Placebo). Infection rates was assessed by invasive Upper Gastrointestinal Endoscopy (UGE)tests that included HP histopathology, HP culture and rapid urease test (RUT), and non-invasive HP tests which included urea breath test (UBT) and fecal antigen test (FAT).

group.title: Group I (HP Vaccine)
group.description: Subjects received three injections of H.pylori(HP) Vaccine at 0, 1, and 2 months, followed by a H.pylori challenge (oral administration of infectious HP inoculum) 1 month later.

group.title: Group II (Placebo)
group.description: Subjects received three injections of Placebo (only aluminum hydroxide adjuvant) at 0, 1, and 2 months, followed by a H.pylori challenge (oral administration of infectious HP inoculum) 1 month later.

measure.title: The Efficacy (Defined as Prevention of Infection) of the HP Vaccine Compared to Placebo.
measure.description: The efficacy of the investigational vaccine to prevent infection following H.pylori challenge in healthy adults was determined in terms of percentage of subjects with positive HP infections in the vaccinated and unvaccinated groups(Placebo). Infection rates was assessed by invasive Upper Gastrointestinal Endoscopy (UGE)tests that included HP histopathology, HP culture and rapid urease test (RUT), and non-invasive HP tests which included urea breath test (UBT) and fecal antigen test (FAT).

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Solicited Local* and Systemic Adverse Events Following Vaccination
outcome.description: To assess the tolerability of an HP vaccine versus placebo in terms of number of subjects reporting solicited local* and systemic adverse events.
outcome.population: This analysis was done on the safety dataset

group.title: Group II (Placebo)

class.title: Stayed at home due to reaction#

outcome.title: The Time Course of HP Infection Following HP Challenge in Vaccinated and Placebo Groups
outcome.description: The time course of HP infection following HP challenge in subjects of the HP vaccine and placebo groups, were assessed by non-invasive HP tests.

group.title: Group I (HP Vaccine)
group.description: Subjects received three injections of H.pylori(HP) Vaccine at 0, 1, and 2 months, followed by a H.pylori challenge (oral administration of infectious HP inoculum) ≥1 month after 3rd injection.

group.title: Group II (Placebo)
group.description: Subjects received three injections of Placebo (only aluminum hydroxide adjuvant) at 0, 1, and 2 months, followed by a H.pylori challenge (oral administration of infectious HP inoculum) ≥1 month after 3rd injection.

measure.title: The Time Course of HP Infection Following HP Challenge in Vaccinated and Placebo Groups
measure.description: The time course of HP infection following HP challenge in subjects of the HP vaccine and placebo groups, were assessed by non-invasive HP tests.

outcome.title: The Geometric Mean Concentrations After HP Vaccination.
outcome.description: The geometric mean concentration of IgG antibody responses to each of the HP vaccine antigens (VacA, CagA and NAP)after HP vaccination as compared to placebo are reported.

group.title: Group II (Placebo)
group.description: Subjects received three injections of Placebo (only aluminum hydroxide adjuvant) at 0, 1, and 2 months, followed by a H.pylori challenge (oral administration of infectious HP inoculum) ≥1 month after 3rd injection.

measure.title: The Geometric Mean Concentrations After HP Vaccination.
measure.description: The geometric mean concentration of IgG antibody responses to each of the HP vaccine antigens (VacA, CagA and NAP)after HP vaccination as compared to placebo are reported.

outcome.description: The geometric mean concentration of IgG antibody responses to each of the HP vaccine antigens (VacA, CagA and NAP) after HP challenge were compared between vaccinated and placebo groups.

outcome.title: Response on Activated Regulatory T Cell Subset Following HP Vaccination and HP Challenge
outcome.description: The response to 3 doses of HP vaccine and the oral HP challenge was assessed with respect their ability to induce differentiation and changes in the phenotype of a subset of regulatory T-cells CD4+CD25+Foxp3+ that expresses Treg Markers PD-1 and/or HLA-DR.

outcome.description: The proliferation of H. pylori-specific Peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs) following HP antigen stimulation was assessed to measure the magnitude of the cell mediated immune response.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
